column3: You wish to teach <Highlight>StringParameter(1)</Highlight> an ability, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>? Then, if you would be so kind as to provide the requisite manual.

I can say with confidence that your race chocobo responded well to the <Sheet(ChocoboRaceAbility,IntegerParameter(1),0)/> training. Pray judge for yourself, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>.
You wish to teach your race chocobo an ability, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>? Then, if you would be so kind as to provide the requisite manual.
...But, more importantly, should you not first register your race chocobo?
Race chocobos cannot be taught abilities until they have been officially registered.
...I gather from your expression that you do not have a training manual?
Race abilities cannot be taught without the requisite manuals, which can be purchased from the tack & feed trader at the race counter.
Hmmm... While I understand your desire to train the finest race chocobo possible, I fear you overestimate your steed's capabilities...
Your race chocobo must unlearn an ability before you can teach it a new one.
A bold strategy, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>madam<Else/>sir</If>, but a futile one, I fear. Chocobos lack the capacity to differentiate between such similar abilities.
Your race chocobo cannot learn two abilities of the same type.
If you wish to teach your chocobo a more powerful version of a learned ability, you must first have it unlearn the weaker version.
